content.question: Over the time interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, is less than or equal to 10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, a particle moves along the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis. The graph of the particle’s velocity <math alttext="v of t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above. Over the time interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, is less than or equal to 10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the particle’s displacement is 15 and the particle travels a total distance of 73. What is the total distance that the particle travels while moving to the left?

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
